name: Trade Titans
title: World's Largest Net Trade Surplus
description: In 2023, China achieved a net trade surplus of approximately $593.9 billion, showcasing its dominance in global trade.

name: Urban Giants
title: Largest Urban Population
description: By 2024, China had 451 million people living in urban agglomerations of over 1 million, highlighting its rapid urbanization.

name: Railway Rulers
title: Leading in Railway Goods Transport
description: In 2019, China transported 3,018,200 million ton-km of goods via railways, underscoring its robust logistics network.

name: Financial Fortresses
title: Largest Total Reserves
description: China's total reserves, including gold, reached $3.26 trillion in 2024, reflecting its strong financial position.

name: Stock Market Surge
title: High Stock Turnover Ratio
description: In 2022, China's stock market had a turnover ratio of 283%, indicating a highly active trading environment.

name: Debt Dilemmas
title: High Short-term Debt Proportion
description: In 2023, 53.19% of China's external debt was short-term, posing potential financial risks.

name: Pollution Price
title: High Carbon Dioxide Damage Costs
description: In 2021, China faced $482.5 billion in carbon dioxide damage, highlighting environmental challenges.

name: Healthcare Hardships
title: Significant Health Expenditure Impact
description: In 2018, 28.61% of China's population was pushed below the poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenses.

name: Aid Independence
title: Minimal Reliance on Foreign Aid
description: In 2022, China received a net official development assistance of -$282 million, showcasing its minimal reliance on foreign aid compared to other nations.

name: Debt Dynamics
title: Significant Net Financial Outflows
description: In 2023, China experienced net financial outflows of over $60 billion through bonds and commercial bank lending, indicating a substantial movement of capital out of the country.

name: Urban Concentration
title: Balanced Urban Population Distribution
description: As of 2024, only 3.24% of China's urban population resides in the largest city, reflecting a more balanced urban population distribution.

name: Poverty Progress
title: Low National Poverty Rate
description: In 2019, only 0.6% of China's population lived below the national poverty line, highlighting significant progress in poverty reduction.

name: Stable Society
title: Minimal Battle-Related Deaths
description: In 2023, China reported just one battle-related death, indicating a stable and peaceful domestic environment.

name: Migration Minimalism
title: Low International Migrant Stock
description: In 2015, international migrants made up only 0.07% of China's population, reflecting a relatively low level of immigration.

name: Early Marriage Rarity
title: Rare Early Marriages Among Women
description: In 2020, only 0.1% of women aged 20-24 in China were married by age 15, indicating a rarity of early marriages.
